result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam James Kieckbusch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge. Pay $500.00 image surcharge.  Court will not impose additional surcharges for the read in counts.
To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
--Register as a sex offender.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (23 pages) commencing APRIL 10, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Adam James Kieckbusch in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Defendant Adam James Kieckbusch in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 44.
Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Statements to the court by state, defense and defendant.  Counsels argue as to the interpretation of 939.617.
AS to count 1:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 18 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Pay a $500.00 image surcharge.
(The court will not impose additional surcharges for the read in counts)
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Register as a sex offender.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Ineligible Voting; Pretrial Credit; Written Explanation Determinate Sentence

Court is in jury trial.  Case is transferred to Br. 38, Judge Wagner, for change of plea.  Attorney Silver and ADA Ballenger contacted with the information (messages left with both).  Attorneys were asked to appear at 8:15 a.m. rather than 10:00 a.m./ds

Defendant Adam James Kieckbusch in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 1 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Counts 2, 3, & 4 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.

Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Adam James Kieckbusch in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received discovery.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam James Kieckbusch in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Information previously filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Information and waives reading.  Court advises the defendant on the charges and penalties.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty on all charges.  Defense has received discovery.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam James Kieckbusch in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Silver is in a jury trial in Br. 26 and cannot appear today.  Arraignment scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant Adam James Kieckbusch in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Ron Dague for Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Dugan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Konkol, Br. 44.  Arraignment scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no Internet Access; No unsupervised visits with minors except for Michael Sparks, Defendant's 17 year old nephew.

Defendant Adam James Kieckbusch in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
